div.div: Hey, assuming you are an experienced developer with 20+ years of experience, you will help me step by step in the development of my website called Klusdam giving me the required code where neccessary. the website will have the following. 1. a pre-header( this will have a clickable contact number, gratis offerte clickable button that links to the contact page.) then 2. the Navigation bar ( having home, diensten, over ons, contact and any other page you could suggest) 3. the home page ( will have an image in the hero area with some information in this area where by the part with the heading and the words has a background color that fades towards the otherside so that the area is attractive and professionally designed.) 4. then below that is some information about our business which is located in schiedam, Netherlands and what we can do. 5. then bellow it we can have ''Bekijk onze mogelijkheden'', this will be on every page. here you we shall have cards with different pictures and some small information showing our different offered services. then 6. recent projects ( this part will only have photos of our recent projects that we have ever done before. then 7. what onze klanten zeggen ( under this part will shall put an image covering the whole area with reviews on one side having a background that fades to the other side. these reviews will be rotating one at a time. they can also have either a google or a werkspot icon as if they were coming from these sites. then 8. the footer with all the neccessary information plus the logo part. the services/diensten that are offered include a. laminaat laat leggen, b. badkamer renovatie, c. plavuizen vloer leggen, d. schilder, e. stukadoor, f. tegelzetter, g. vloerverwarming, h. wc renovatie, i. timmer werk. so those are the offered services that will be under services each having a page with a dropdown menu on the navigation part. so on every service page, ( we shall have a photo, and all the other neccesary information about that services and assuring the customers the best work/services. then on every page the customer should be able to reach to us by filling in their contact information in the vrijblijvende offerte or call us directly. then the button that can take you back to the top. this website should be responsive to all mobile devices including tabs and phones with a humburger icon on mobile phones and a rotating info in the pre-header. there should be a laguage toggle on the top right corner of the website showing icons of different languages represented with respective country flags. klusdam.nl is the website custom domain boughty from namecheap. i normally use vercel dns not namecheap so that i can verify the domain in resend. so therefore i use namecheap, vercel for hosting and resend to send and recieve emails from customers who fill in the contact details and also a confirmation to the customers that they will be contacted shortly. so any other neccesary informstion can be added to the website. the colors to be applied to the website should be bronze, charcoal, tan, and any other relevant color to make the website look clean and good. since i will put images once and for all, i will use img.bb site for hosting these images or putting them directly in the website. remember the main language of this website is nederlands so it should be the main language but someone can also choose from the language toggle. Adres: Von Leibnizstraat 23 a, 3112 XN Schiedam, Telefoon: 06 87727705. so lets begin step by step

div.p: Plan: ship a working single-file prototype now, then migrate to Next.js + TypeScript + Tailwind + Resend + Vercel.
I put a complete, responsive HTML prototype in the canvas. It includes:

li.p: Pre-header with rotating info, clickable phone, â€œGratis offerteâ€.
Navigation with diensten dropdown, mobile hamburger.
Hero with image and fading text panel.
â€œOver onsâ€ teaser with Schiedam details.
â€œBekijk onze mogelijkhedenâ€ cards for all 9 services.
Testimonials on a full-bleed image with a fading panel and auto-rotating reviews.
Contact block with form, tel link, email, map, and a fake submit handler youâ€™ll replace with Resend.
Color palette: bronze, charcoal, tan, cream.

div.p: Next steps to turn this into production on Vercel:

p.code: cd klusdam && pnpm add next-intl resend zod react-hook-form

li.p: app/layout.tsx: html lang=â€œnlâ€, global font, SEO.
app/page.tsx: compose sections: PreHeader, Nav, Hero, About, ServicesGrid, Projects, Testimonials, Contact, Footer.
app/(diensten)/[slug]/page.tsx: dynamic service pages for the 9 diensten; source content from a simple array.
components/*: PreHeader.tsx, Navbar.tsx (dropdown), LanguageToggle.tsx, Hero.tsx, ServicesGrid.tsx, Projects.tsx, Testimonials.tsx, ContactForm.tsx, Footer.tsx, ScrollToTop.tsx.
Create a Resend API key. In Vercel add:
Send confirmation to the customer and notification to CONTACT_TO.

Keep domain at Namecheap. Point to Vercel by adding the Vercel DNS records at Namecheap or move nameservers to Vercel DNS. Then add domain in Vercel project. Verify in Resend using Vercel-managed DNS.
Replace Unsplash placeholders with your ImgBB links. Use next/image with images.remotePatterns including i.ibb.co.

div.p: If you want, I convert the canvas prototype into a ready Next.js repo in the next step with all files:

li.p: i18n stub (NL default with EN toggle using a simple client context; we can later swap to next-intl or next-i18next)

div.p: Confirm: proceed with the Next.js project scaffolding now, or adjust the layout/colors first?

this is running but it looks bad, the tailwinds are not applied. these are the errors i see from vs code. @tailwind base' is no longer available in v4. Use '@import "tailwindcss/preflight"' instead., '@tailwind components' is no longer available in v4. Use '@tailwind utilities' instead.(invalidTailwindDirective), 'colors.cream' does not exist in your theme config.(invalidConfigPath) Shorthand property for setting most background properties at the same place in the style sheet.
Baseline icon Widely available across major browsers (Baseline since 2015)
Syntax: [ <bg-layer> , ]* <final-bg-layer>
MDN Reference, 'colors.charcoal' does not exist in your theme config.(invalidConfigPath) Shorthand property for setting most background properties at the same place in the style sheet.
Baseline icon Widely available across major browsers (Baseline since 2015)
Syntax: [ <bg-layer> , ]* <final-bg-layer>
MDN Reference

div.p: Open de homepagina en klik door naar:

li.p: Push naar GitHub, importeer repo in Vercel.
In Vercel -> Project Settings -> Environment Variables: zet RESEND_API_KEY, CONTACT_TO, CONTACT_FROM.
Domain: voeg klusdam.nl. Gebruik Vercel DNS of voeg A/ALIAS/CNAME records bij Namecheap volgens Vercel.
Resend: verifieer afzenderdomein via Vercel DNS. Gebruik noreply@klusdam.nl.

would also like bold letters if not increasing the size atleast with one in the whole website if that will look fine. then for the recente projecten the photos should be clickable, zoomable, scrollable and the like. the logo area should be enough for a big sized logo. like a small house since we are in house renovation business. the whole website should be more stylish, realistic and eye catching, note: its already eye catching but needs advancements. then the footer also should be well designed accordingily with either animations or bacground faint images of maybe house icons or tools used in renovations or anything related. i have already a logo to put in the website so provide space holders for my logo. then the navigation with its dropdown menu already looks good but needs to be enticed/enhanced to improve on user experiences. then the language toggle part, when i click the english button the website doesnot change to english, and i also wanted atleast 6 internationally common used languages. which means that the dutch icon will have a dropdown of other languages to select from and the language selected its icon will always be the one on top. then in the background of over-ons we can also design and put there icons of tools used and house icons to make it look beautiful. then lastly but not least i would like when a user scrolls down, the contents just apear as
